1.text: Prune your cucumbers when they grow 1–2 ft (0.30–0.61 m) tall.

2.text: Prune your cucumbers every 1-2 weeks for best results.

3.text: Remove damaged, diseased vines or flowers whenever you notice them.

4.text: Follow the main vine up the plant to find the suckers.

5.text: Get rid of 4-6 suckers growing from the bottom of the cucumber plant.

6.text: Cut off any damaged or unhealthy cucumbers using pruning shears.

7.text: Avoid removing the leaves or flowers of your plant.

8.text: Train your plants as soon as the flowers first appear if using a trellis.

9.text: Secure the main vine to the trellis with gardening clips.

10.text: Continue adding clips as your cucumber vines grow.

11.text: Remove any lateral suckers you notice as you clip up your vine.

12.text: Avoid trimming away the thin, vine-line tendrils.
